main_definition: To observe or monitor something with attention, often as a habitual action.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To keep an eye on someone or something to ensure safety or prevent unauthorized actions.
meanings_and_examples.example: I'll watch the kids while you finish your work.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To check the time periodically, typically by looking at a wristwatch.
meanings_and_examples.example: She glanced at her watch to see what time it was.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A device worn on the wrist for indicating time.
meanings_and_examples.example: He bought a new digital watch as a birthday gift.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To be vigilant or alert to changes in circumstances or surroundings.
meanings_and_examples.example: The security guard will watch over the premises throughout the night.
